channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:50:22 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: After Donald Trump's victory Americans explore moving abroad options online
item.description: Following Donald Trump's projected second term win, Americans are showing a renewed interest in emigration. Google searches for "move to Canada," "New Zealand," and "Australia" have skyrocketed, mirroring the trend seen after the 2016 election. Immigration lawyers and consultants are reporting a surge in inquiries from concerned Americans citing societal anxieties and fears of diminishing freedoms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why the British Royal family wear red poppy pins in November
item.description: The British royal family, including Prince William, Kate Middleton, Prince Harry, and Meghan Markle, demonstrate unity by wearing red poppy pins every November to commemorate Remembrance Day. The tradition, rooted in John McCrae's World War I poem "In Flanders Fields," honors fallen soldiers. The royals participate in various commemorative events, culminating in a ceremony at The Cenotaph in London.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkey's Erdogan sees easy end to Ukraine war if Trump takes solution-based approach, media reports
'Evil and psycho': Father accused of murder of British-Pakistani girl blames stepmother
item.description: Urfan Sharif, the father of 10-year-old Sara Sharif found dead with multiple injuries, denied murdering his daughter in a London court. He blamed his partner, Beinash Batool, for the abuse, describing her as "evil" and claiming she forced him to hit Sara. Sharif admitted to slapping his daughter and finding her bound with tape but denied causing her fatal injuries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fame to scandal: Chinese teen math genius exposed as fraud
item.description: Jiang Ping, a vocational school student from China, was initially lauded for her exceptional performance in a prestigious mathematics competition. However, organizers have since disqualified her, stating that she received assistance from her teacher during the preliminary round. The incident has sparked debate about academic integrity and the pressures faced by students in China's competitive education system.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: President-elect Trump appoints Susie Wiles as White House chief of staff, marking historic first
item.description: Donald Trump has appointed Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff, making her the first woman to hold the position. Wiles, a veteran Republican strategist, played a key role in Trump's successful 2024 presidential campaign. Known for her ability to manage Trump's behavior, Wiles is expected to bring stability and experience to the role.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Real-life Jumanji scenario in this US state after over 40 monkeys escape research facility
item.description: In a scene straight out of Jumanji, over 40 monkeys escaped their enclosure at a South Carolina research facility after a new employee's mishap. The escaped primates, all young females, are not considered dangerous and are being lured back with food. Authorities are urging residents to keep their distance and report any sightings immediately.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel's new defence minister Israel Katz sworn in
item.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu replaced defence minister Yoav Gallant amidst the ongoing Gaza conflict, citing trust issues. This decision sparked criticism and protests across Israel. The conflict also led to diplomatic tensions with France after Israeli authorities briefly detained two French gendarmes in Jerusalem.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump on track to win popular vote, first Republican to do so in 20 years
item.description: President-elect Trump is projected to win the popular vote in the presidential election, a feat not achieved by a Republican candidate in 20 years. Current vote counts show Trump surpassing Vice President Kamala Harris by roughly 4.6 million votes. Pre-election polls predicted a close race in the Electoral College but anticipated Harris securing more votes overall.

item.title: Day 1 as prez-elect: Trump keeps a low profile, receives congratulations
item.description: Donald Trump spent his first day as president-elect fielding congratulatory calls from Hillary Clinton, world leaders, and President Biden. Biden invited Trump to the Oval Office to discuss the transition of power. While Trump has accepted the invitation, formal transition talks have yet to begin.

item.title: Did Musk sign poll cheques to end checks on his clout?
item.description: Elon Musk, a prominent supporter of Donald Trump, reportedly requested the former president to appoint SpaceX employees to key positions within his administration, particularly in the defense department. This proposition, made during Trump's presidential transition, raises concerns about potential conflicts of interest due to Musk's companies' extensive government contracts.

item.title: Trump comes out with flying colours on diversity
item.description: Donald Trump secured a decisive victory over Kamala Harris, attracting support from core Democratic constituencies. Trump's success with black and Latino voters, particularly in working-class communities, suggests a potential shift in Republican demographics, despite ongoing societal divisions.

item.title: 'Bring down temp': Biden vows peaceful transition
item.description: President Biden delivered a conciliatory address following Donald Trump's victory over Kamala Harris, urging Americans to unite and reduce political tensions. Biden pledged a smooth transition of power and emphasized the importance of respecting election integrity. He also encouraged his supporters, reminding them that setbacks are inevitable but giving up is not an option.

item.title: 'Global headwinds' blamed for election result in first White House briefing since Nov 5
item.description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre attributed the Democrats' election losses partly to global challenges affecting incumbent leaders worldwide. “There’s going to be a lot of punditry, a lot of election experts who are going to have their opinions, who are going to have their thoughts, but the president is very, very proud of what he’s been able to accomplish and incredibly impressed with what the vice president was able to do,” Jean-Pierre said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz's first reaction to election loss; tears and hand over heart as Harris speaks
item.description: More embarrassing defeat for Tim Walz came today as Donald Trump won in Minnesota county where Tim Walz started his political career. The overall presidential vote in Minnesota, however, went to Harris and Walz. As Harris spoke yesterday at Howard, Tim Walz was seen crying. Kamala Harris step-daughter Ella Emhoff was also seen breaking down.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Donald Trump said he wouldn't protect Prince Harry; Meghan Markle's 'divisive' jibe
item.description: Harry and Meghan have a plan B as well -- though it's not certain what they had in mind before they purchased a new house in Portugal -- to flee the US or to flex their defiance near home (UK). According to the experts, Meghan will never shift her base to anywhere else as she has big Hollywood dreams which she is still pursuing despite losing her popularity every day.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Donald Trump Jr say his father's cabinet won't have people smarter than the President?
item.description: Don Jr is part of the transition team as Donald Trump is now preparing for his second term in the White House. Some obvious names are Tesla CEO Elon Musk for department of government efficiency which will be set up as Musk himself claimed many times and Trump promised the Musk would be part of the administration. Another key player is RFK Jr who quit his independent presidential race and endorsed Donald Trump. Trump hinted that RFK Jr, a health crusader, will be given health and environment-related roles. And then there is Tulsi Gabbard.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Morning Joe host shocked to learn butter price. 'Is it framed in gold?'
item.description: “Butter is $7… What, is it framed in gold?” Scarborough was shocked. “If you look at the cost of groceries, if you look at the cost of gas, if you look at the cost of things compared to four years ago it was a very simple answer for working-class Americans. Things didn't cost so much,” the former Republican said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Voted for Donald Trump but not Kari Lake': Arizona election latest updates
item.description: 55-year-old Kari Lake is a former Fox 10 news anchor and journalist who lost the 2022 governor's race and called it an election fraud. Lake quit journalism to enter politics and became a MAGA spokesperson. During Covid, she led anti-mask rallies and said as governor she would not tolerate mask and vaccine mandates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Jimmy Kimmel tears up speaking about 'terrible' election night
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel said it was a bad night for those who voted for Donald Trump; just that they didn't understand it. It was a 'disaster of a night' for Melania, Kimmel said. It was only a good night for Putin, polio and lovable billionaires like Elon Musk, Kimmel said. "I will say something that Trump would never say unless it favoured him.... He won. That doesn't mean we give up and that doesn't mean we storm the Capitol because we don't like the result," Kimmel said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
